Articles.Content:
I saw this when it came to Steam. Watching a couple of video reviews, it looked like it was a really raw, unfinished game. I bought it anyway and am very glad I did. I followed the in-game tutorial and confidently took my rocket to the launch pad. However, I didn't have a printout of any controls. After mashing buttons I found that the spacebar did something, so I pressed it several times. This is without having discovered the throttle on a LFB! After two more attempts at launch and seeing my ship just jump a little and wobble in circles, I backed up a bit.

I'm greatly looking forward to seeing the game develop and expect to play it a long time. Thanks for getting this out for people to see.

All the controls are listed in the settings menus, so you can see what they are and/or change them there. There's also a page on the game's wiki, http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Controls, but I haven't checked to see how current it is.
It's a really good game for just trying things and learning from mistakes. It's very intuitive.
